data.title: Famous Birthdays on March 18
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays for the 18th of March. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals were born on March 18.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 297

Abu al-Qasim Mahmud ibn Umar al-Zamakhshari, Muslim scholar of Persian origin, born in Zamakhshar, Khwarezmia (d. 1144)

Lidwina, Dutch mystic (Christ's Bride) and saint, born in Schiedam, Netherlands (d. 1433)

John Holland, 2nd Duke of Exeter, English military leader during the Hundred Years' War, born in Dartington, Devonshire, England (d. 1447)

Mary Tudor, daughter of Henry VII of England and queen consort of Louis XII of France (d. 1533)

Cornelis Ketel, Dutch portrait painter and poet, born in Gouda (d. 1616)

Francois of Valois, French duke of Anjou, youngest son of French King Henry II and Catherine de' Medici, Duke of Brabant, (d. 1584)

Adam Elsheimer, German painter, cartoonist and etcher, born in Frankfurt (d. 1610) [date baptized]

Manuel de Faria e Sousa, Portuguese historian and poet, born in Felgueiras, Kingdom of Portugal (d. 1649)

Jacques de Billy, French mathematician (d. 1679)

Simon Bradstreet, Massachusetts Bay colonist (d. 1693)

Frederick III, King of Denmark and Norway (1648-70), born in Haderslev, Denmark (d. 1670)

Philippe de la Hire, French mathematician and astronomer (d. 1719)

Gottfried Wegner, German theologian, hymn composer, and court preacher at Konigsberg, born in Oels, Duchy of Oels (now Oleśnica, Poland) (d. 1709)

Giuseppe Ottavio Pitoni, Italian Baroque composer, organist, and maestro di cappella (Basilica of San Marco. 1677-1743), born in Rieti, Papal States (d. 1743)

Matthew Decker, English merchant and writer (d. 1759)

Ralph Ersine, Scottish minister (d. 1752)

Christian Goldbach, German mathematician (Goldbach position), born in Königsberg, Brandenburg-Prussia (d. 1764)

Niclas Sahlgren, Swedish merchant and philanthropist (d. 1776)

Johann Christoph Vogel, German composer, born in the Free Imperial City of Nuremberg, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1788)

David Hendrik Chasse, Dutch general (fought Napoleon at Waterloo), born in Tiel, Netherlands (d. 1849)

Milos Obrenovic, Leader of The Second Serbian Uprising and Prince of Serbia (d. 1860)

John C. Calhoun

US Vice President (1825-32), born in Abbeville, South Carolina

Numa Denis Fustel de Coulanges, French historian and sociologist (The Ancient City), born in Paris (d. 1889)

Grover Cleveland

22nd and 24th US President (1885-89, 1893-97), born in Caldwell, New Jersey

Jules Vandenpeereboom, Belgian politician (Prime Minister of Belgium 1899), born in Kortrijk, Belgium (d. 1917)

French-born German engineer who invented the diesel engine, born in Paris

British Prime Minister (Conservative: 1937-40), born in Birmingham, England

Jimmy 'Nixey' Callahan, American baseball pitcher, outfielder and manager (Chicago White Sox; first AL no-hitter 1902), born in Fitchburg, Massachusetts (d. 1934)

American civil rights activist, born in Mount Meigs, Alabama
